alert.note: Alert for Hardin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:56AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF HARDIN COUNTY THROUGH 530 AM EDT... At 455 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Arlington, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Kenton, Ada, Forest, Dunkirk, Alger, Blanchard, Mcguffey, Patterson, Dola, Grant, Huntersville, Pfeiffer, Walton, Hepburn and Mentzer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
